solution_line_template: In a week, each section collected {kilos_in_two_weeks}/{weeks_collected} = <<{kilos_in_two_weeks}/{weeks_collected}={kilos_per_section_per_week}>>{kilos_per_section_per_week} kilos of newspapers.

So, in three weeks, one section collected {kilos_per_section_per_week} x {total_weeks_collected} = <<{kilos_per_section_per_week}*{total_weeks_collected}={kilos_per_section_three_weeks}>>{kilos_per_section_three_weeks} kilos.

So, the {sections_in_calculation} sections collected a total of {kilos_per_section_three_weeks} x {sections_in_calculation} = <<{kilos_per_section_three_weeks}*{sections_in_calculation}={total_kilos_collected_by_sections}>>{total_kilos_collected_by_sections} kilos.

Hence, their target is to collect {total_kilos_collected_by_sections} + {kilos_needed_more} = <<{total_kilos_collected_by_sections}+{kilos_needed_more}={target_kilos}>>{target_kilos} kilos of the newspaper.
